title: Ahamani EV Tech explores technology transfer opportunities to Indian auto companies
content: Ahamani's UrDa AIOT Mobility System, which has been operational since 2017, plays a crucial role in managing electric two-wheeler fleets and battery packs. The company has also patented an e-Scooter rental management system and a leasing program, both of which have received widespread recognition. With over 20 years of experience in the electric vehicle industry, Ahamani emphasizes innovation and quality.

title: IAC urges automakers towards Auto LPG for lower emissions and costs
content: The IAC urges OEMs like Maruti Suzuki to adopt Auto LPG, which emits 20% less CO2, 60% less diesel, nearly no particulate matter, and is 40% cheaper. Conversion costs INR 30,000. It's a competitive, sustainable option for stricter norms. Globally, 27 million vehicles use Auto LPG, showing significant growth.

title: Tata Technologies partners with Arm to drive innovation in SDVs
content: In this partnership, Tata Technologies will develop a SOAFEE reference architecture stack using Arm's Automotive Enhanced (AE) technologies and Arm Compute Subsystems (CSS) for Automotive. This development will be supported by a cloud-native framework that integrates various DevSecOps and virtual platform solutions, accelerating the time to market for automakers.

title: Jitendra EV announces new upgrades for JMT Model
content: With a starting price of INR 70,000, the JMT model is an economical solution for businesses transitioning to electric vehicles and consumers looking for eco-friendly travel options. The robust design ensures durability and lower maintenance costs, making it ideal for both commercial and residential users. Features include a split rear seat for comfort and a spacious cargo area, making it suitable for delivering food, groceries, dairy products, pharmacy items, and more. It's also a viable option for personal commuting.

title: Hinduja Tech signs definitive agreement to acquire TECOSIM Group
content: Hinduja Tech is focused on expanding its mobility engineering services worldwide. The acquisition of TECOSIM Group, which employs over 650 people, will give Hinduja Tech a significant foothold in Europe. This move is intended to broaden the company's geographic reach and provide access to key customer accounts in the region.

title: Roadcast and AMU collaborate to make EV leasing more accessible and risk-free
content: Roadcast is a leader in fleet management solutions, offering smart tools like GPS tracking, while AMU has been pivotal in promoting the adoption of EVs. By integrating GPS technology in the 3W e-rickshaws leased by AMU, the company will be able to predict and identify non-performing assets and potential defaulters. The analytics capabilities provided by Roadcast’s technology will also offer insights into the performance of original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), enabling AMU to make more informed decisions.

title: Electrics, hybrids and ICE: Suzuki advocates multi pathway approach for the next decade
content: Japan’s Suzuki Motor Corporation (SMC) has underlined the efficacy of HEVs, saying that in regions where adoption of non-fossil fuel electric energy is lower, HEVs are the best choice. In a 10-year technology roadmap outlined earlier today, Chief Technology Officer Katushiro Kato has said that EVs become the better choice only when adoption of non-fossil fuel electric energy reaches 75%.

title: Tokyo airport trials driverless cargo vehicle
content: Tokyo's Haneda Airport is trialling a driverless vehicle to tow cargo containers in an attempt to get around labour shortages as the number of tourists flying into Japan soars. The vehicle at one of the world's busiest airports can tow up to 13 tons of containers, joint developers All Nippon Airways (ANA) and Toyota Industries said in a statement.

title: Green hydrogen consumption to be escalated from 2040, says Atul Jairaj, Deloitte
content: Deloitte's report at ETAuto Tech Summit 2024 calls for a transition from ICE to non-ICE vehicles like CNG, LPG, biofuel, green hydrogen, and EVs to reduce import bills and achieve sustainability. FY 2023-24 saw 232.5 million metric tonnes of crude oil imports. The report targets carbon neutrality by 2070 and greenhouse gas reductions by 2045, addressing vehicle afterlife sustainability.

title: It's easy to criticize, hard to create; my motto is never give up, says Henrik Fisker
content: Fisker admitted that while the auto industry might be the hardest to succeed, the nascent EV industry is even more difficult. But he is personally “excited about doing great work in this industry and bringing new innovative EVs to the world”. Charging infrastructure is in the early stages of becoming as reliable as gas fueling systems. Other challenges on the manufacturing front, development cost, government policies also exist.
